details.overview: Use Defra's catchment sensitive farming (CSF) advisory tool to find out how to limit the risk of polluting local water
details.more_information:
This tool uses [Government Gateway](/government-gateway "Government Gateway"). 

##Getting help
Contact the Farming Advice Service if you have any queries about catchment sensitive farming.

$C
**Farming Advice Service**  
0845 345 1302   
Monday to Friday, 9am to 5pm  
$C

##Agents
Sign up as an [agent](https://secure.services.defra.gov.uk/wps/portal/wfa/!ut/p/c5/04_SB8K8xLLM9MSSzPy8xBz9CP0os3gzdx8LQyd_A0t3X3dHA08fM1fvAEdXY3cTI6B8JE55A3dDSnQbmBHQHQ5yLX7b8cmDzAfJG-AAjgb6fh75uan6BbmhEQaZAekAekimGQ!!/dl3/d3/L2dBISEvZ0FBIS9nQSEh/ "Sign up as an agent for Defra farm surveys and assessments"){:rel="external"} if you want to use the CSF tool for more than one farmer.

##Catchment sensitive farming grants
Grants of up to Â£10,000 are available in some areas for infrastructure investments that reduce diffuse water pollution. 

Find out more on the [Natural England](http://www.naturalengland.org.uk/ourwork/farming/csf/default.aspx "Catchment sensitive farming (Natural England)"){:rel="external"} website.

##Cross compliance
These standards are part of [cross compliance.](http://rpa.defra.gov.uk/rpa/index.nsf/UIMenu/814240C66F10CAC8802570C7004248D4?Opendocument "Cross compliance (Rural Payments Agency)"){:rel="external"} You must meet them to get your farming subsidy under the [Single Payment Scheme](/single-payment-scheme-online "Manage your Single Payment Scheme online"). 


*[CSF]: Catchment sensitive farming
